# Google Earth Engine

## How To Sign Up {-}

Sign up as soon as possible. Google Earth Engine will be needed for the technical sessions. It is not required for the General Session.

Steps:

1.  [Sign up](https://signup.earthengine.google.com/){target="_blank"} for access.

2.  An automated system does an initial accept/reject immediately upon submitting the application.

3.  Wait a few minutes.

4.  Go to the [Code Editor](https://code.earthengine.google.com/){target="_blank"} to see if you have access.

If you don't have access or are rejected please reach out to **dglenn@woodwellclimate.org**.

Another useful guide can be found [here](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/step-by-step-create-your-google-earth-engine-account-khang-vu-tien){target="_blank"}.

## Get Data & Scripts for Workshop {-}

Download data for <span style="color: #FF7733;">**Tuesday, January 17**</span> [here](https://github.com/WoodwellRisk/Nepal_Workshops/blob/master/data/DataFiles-Technical_Session_Day_1.zip).

Download data for <span style="color: #FF7733;">**Thursday, January 19**</span> [here](https://github.com/WoodwellRisk/Nepal_Workshops/tree/master/data/DataFiles-Technical_Session_Day_3). You only to download 1 folder worth of data. For example: Heat/35oC **OR** Cold/0oC **OR** Precipitation/Number_Of_Events_Considered_Extreme.

Scripts for both days are found [here](https://github.com/WoodwellRisk/Nepal_Workshops/tree/master/data/scripts).

**Intro to Coding** An excellent quickstart guide for [javascript](https://learnxinyminutes.com/docs/javascript/), the language used in Google Earth Engine. If you are intereset in other programming languages the website [Learn X in Y Minutes](https://learnxinyminutes.com)is an easy place to start. 

**Beginner's Codebook** A fantastic resource that walk you through simple commands. Very easy to understand. Assumes no prior experience with GIS or coding. Check it out [here](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/community/beginners-cookbook).

**Tutorials** There are self-paced [written tutorials](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/tutorials) and [video tutorials](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/videos). [Community tutorials](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/community/explore) are also available. Google Earth Engine has also created potential [lesson plans](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/edu) geared towards universities.

**Power Users** Some power users make their code available to the general public. If you click on the following links their code will show upper under your **Reader** drop down in the **Scripts** tab.

A good intro: [https://code.earthengine.google.com/?accept_repo=users/gorelick/EE101-B](https://code.earthengine.google.com/?accept_repo=users/gorelick/EE101-B)

**Geo For Good Summit** hosted by Google Earth Engine every October. Virtual attendance is free and sessions will be recorded. Learn more [here](https://earthoutreachonair.withgoogle.com).
